intro: Zeuxine andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the genus Zeuxine in the family Gentianaceae, which includes around 250 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
